page.title: 17A multi-fuel cooker
page.content: Most homes are heated by electricity, coal,or oil, as there is no natural gas supplied to this area. Since an epidemic of Dutch Elm disease among the trees in this area,there has been an abundance of cheap,even free wood.Some homes have taken advantage of this and installed multi-fuel cookers. One particular stove is made in France and as well as acting as a cooker it provides hot water and heats fifteen radiators for central heating.It burns wood,straw logs and solid fuel.Daily maintenance is essential to prevent the fire from going out and the chimney must be swept annually.It is reliable and provides a focal point in the kitchen.The family even give it a pet name...Gladys!When storms leave the rest of the village without electricity this particular family are warm and well fed.
